official-title.#text:
Recognizing the roles and contributions of
		  America’s teachers to building and enhancing our Nation’s civic, cultural, and
		  economic well-being.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Education and the
			 Workforce

cosponsor.#tail:
)
			 submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
thanks and promotes the profession of teaching by encouraging students,
			 parents, school administrators, and public officials to participate in teacher
			 appreciation events during

text.#text:
Whereas education and knowledge are the foundation of
			 America’s current and future strength;

term.#tail:
, held during May 6, 2013, through May 10, 2013, is to raise public
			 awareness of the unquantifiable contributions of teachers and to promote
			 greater respect and understanding for the teaching profession; and

text.#text:
Whereas students, schools, communities, and a number of
			 organizations representing educators are hosting teacher appreciation events in
			 recognition of

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 167 IH: Recognizing the roles and contributions of America’s teachers to building and enhancing our Nation’s civic, cultural, and economic well-being.
